As Filon and Xiangling walked through the streets of Liyue, Filon couldn't help but feel a bit nervous. He had been practicing his cooking skills for weeks, trying to perfect a traditional Portuguese dish to impress Xiangling. He had even gone to Ganyu, the secretary of the Liyue Qixing, for advice on where to find the best ingredients.

"I hope you like this, Xiangling," Filon said, trying to sound confident. "I've been working on it for a while now."

Xiangling smiled at him. "I'm sure it will be great, Filon. You're always so thoughtful."

As they approached Filon's mansion, they were greeted by Ningguang, the Tianquan of the Liyue Qixing. "Filon, Xiangling, what a surprise to see you both here," she said.

Filon grinned. "I wanted to cook a special meal for Xiangling, and I thought it would be even better if we had some company."

Ningguang's eyes lit up. "Cooking, you say? I happen to be quite skilled in the kitchen myself. Perhaps I could lend a hand?"

Filon nodded eagerly. "I would love that, Ningguang. And there's someone else I'd like you to meet." He led them into the kitchen, where they were greeted by a tall, dark-haired man with a thick Italian accent.

"This is my friend Marco, from Sicily," Filon explained. "He's been teaching me how to make Neapolitan-style pizza."

Marco grinned and waved. "Ciao! It's a pleasure to meet you both."

As they set to work, Filon explained the process of making a traditional margherita pizza. He mixed together flour, water, salt, and yeast to create the dough, then rolled it out into a thin, circular shape. Next, he spread a layer of crushed tomatoes over the dough, followed by slices of mozzarella cheese and a few fresh basil leaves.

"And now, the most important part," Marco said, grinning as he pulled out a small jar of olive oil. "A little bit of this, just around the edges of the crust, and your pizza will be perfect."

Filon carefully drizzled the oil over the edges of the crust, then slid the pizza into the oven to bake. As the aroma of freshly baked bread and melted cheese filled the kitchen, Ningguang and Xiangling couldn't help but be impressed.

Filon and Xiangling walked through the bustling streets of Liyue, the fragrant smells of various foods filling the air. Filon's stomach grumbled at the thought of all the delicious options available to them.

"Hey Xiangling, have you ever tried Neapolitan-style pizza?" Filon asked, his eyes sparkling with excitement.

"No, I haven't," Xiangling replied, looking intrigued. "What's Neapolitan-style pizza?"

"It's a traditional Italian pizza that originated in Naples," Filon explained. "It's made with tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, and fresh basil, and it's cooked in a wood-fired oven at a high temperature for a short amount of time. It's one of my favorite dishes to cook."

"It sounds delicious," Xiangling said, a smile spreading across her face. "Do you think you could make some for us?"

Filon grinned. "Absolutely! I'd love to show off my pizza-making skills. Let's go to the market and pick up some ingredients."

The two of them made their way to the market, where Filon carefully selected the freshest tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil he could find. They also grabbed some flour, yeast, and olive oil.

Once they had everything they needed, Filon led Xiangling back to his mansion, where he set to work on the pizza. He mixed the flour, yeast, and water to create the dough, then let it rise for a few hours.

While they waited, Filon and Xiangling chatted and enjoyed each other's company. Finally, the dough was ready. Filon carefully stretched it out into a thin circle and placed it on a baking sheet. He then topped it with the sliced tomatoes, shreds of mozzarella, and a sprinkle of basil.

"This looks amazing," Xiangling said, her eyes wide with excitement.

Filon chuckled and placed the pizza in the oven. As it cooked, the aroma of the melting cheese and the sizzling crust filled the kitchen.

As he waited for the pizza to cook, Filon chatted with Ganyu and Ningguang about his travels and experiences in Italy. Ganyu listened with interest, asking questions about the different regions and their cuisine. Ningguang seemed more skeptical, but was intrigued by the idea of a Neapolitan-style pizza.

Finally, the timer went off and Filon carefully removed the pizza from the oven. He garnished it with fresh basil leaves and cut it into slices.

Ganyu eagerly took a slice and took a bite, savoring the flavors. "This is delicious," she exclaimed.

Ningguang took a more cautious approach, taking a small bite and nodding in approval. "Not bad," she said. "The tomato sauce is very flavorful and the cheese is melted perfectly."

Filon beamed with pride at the positive reactions. "I'm glad you like it," he said. "I learned to make it when I was studying in Italy. It's a classic dish from the region of Naples."
